snippet: Jim Cleamons, a current assistant and former Knicks player, has ties to Phil Jackson, the team president, and an awkward history with Walt Frazier, the TV analyst.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column on New York Knicks' signing of former point guard Jim Cleamons as an assistant coach; contends that all these years later, Cleamons is back for job not unlike one he signed on for in 1977—to help drill some common team sense into a collection of disparate, underachieving but physically gifted souls.
lead_paragraph: Jim Cleamons, a current assistant and former Knicks player, has ties to Phil Jackson, the team president, and an awkward history with Walt Frazier, the TV analyst.

headline.main: Reminder of Knicks’ Dysfunction Is Again Hoping to Solve It
headline.print_headline: Reminder of Knicks’ Dysfunction Is Again Hoping to Solve It
